text.title: Visiting Rome: Delicious Food & Iconic Sights (Staying in Charming Trastevere)
text.p: with everything Rome has to offer I'm so
glad we spent a full five days exploring
this historical and impressive City our
stay in the Charming trast neighborhood
gave us the perfect mix of local Vibes
and easy access to incredible
restaurants bars and iconic
landmarks during our time here we not
only ate great food and experience some
of the city's Rich history but also
picked up some valuable tips and tricks
that I'll be sharing with you in this
video when arriving at our centrally
located hotel we left our luggage in
this beautiful and spacious room before
walking out in the streets of trast for
some lunch we stopped at trapino a spot
famous for its delicious traditional
Roman Street
food we began with something called sule
a seasoned ball of rotto rice that is
breaded and deep fried okay I'm going to
try
one okay I think this is the classic one
this is with the mozzarella yeah it
looks really nice like tomato
sauce the classic version filled with
tomato sauce and mozzarella was
especially impressive we followed up by
sharing three different kinds of trapino
which are essentially crispy pizza
pockets filled with various Roman stews
and they were all
delicious a 20 minute walk then led us
to Piaza venetsia one of Rome's most
iconic squares celebrated for its
stunning architecture and Rich
historical
significance whether you're interested
in history or simply looking for a
breathtaking view I highly recommend a
visit here after a bit of walking around
in the bustling streets of central Rome
I must say it was a relief to return to
the Tranquil charm of trast where we
could unwind and enjoy our relaxing
ativo the Wine and Food here were
delicious and the Cozy atmosphere added
to the overall experience
okay oh my God it's
good like a

was good and the food was
we finished our first day with some
tasty fried lasagna and beer to go

God an ancient site in the heart of Rome
that served as the center of public life
during the Roman Empire

the best time to visit the Roman forum
and Coliseum is either early in the
morning when it first open opens or late
in the afternoon around closing time
also weekday are generally preferred
over weekends additionally buying skip
the line tickets in advance or booking a
guided tour will save you time and
enhance your
visit I don't think you any higher than

beautifully aligned through a lush
Garden yeah while I couldn't capture it
on camera I highly recommend experience
it for yourself besides this unexpected
site the surrounding Parks offer
beautiful panoramas of Rome that are
well worth the visit
[Music]
after enjoying some Italian Del es we
ended the day with a beer to go in the
Evening Sun before heading back to the
hotel for a good night
sleep our third day began with a visit
to the Vatican
Museum thankfully we had bought skip the
line tickets in advance which made our
entry quick and
easy the museum is among the most
visited in the world offering a glimpse
into the rich cultural and religious
religious Heritage of the Catholic
[Music]

went for a quick lunch that was tasty
but not over

came next with a stop for some delicious
tiis Su at this popular

my
favorite we spent the afternoon back in
our favorite neighborhood for some
drinks in the
sun in time for ativo we went back to

oroni

and while the pasta was good it didn't

at

now it's like 7 in the
morning so I lot
better besides getting here as early as
possible ideally when it opens at 700
a.m. another recommendation is to avoid
visiting St Peter's Basilica on
Wednesdays if possible on this day the
pope holds his papal audience in St
Peter Square which attracts large crowds
and can cause delays or Limited access
to the Basilica during the morning
hours after admiring The Majestic church
you can pay a visit to the top of St
Peter's Basilica called The Dome or
cupula you can either take an elevator
partway up or climb the full
551 steps to reach the top having a bit
of claustrophobic issues I took the
elevator and then walked the remaining
steps which was more than enough in my
casee
flashback do set
up okay
wow once at the top The View was
incredibly impressive with St Peter
Square laid out below and a sweeping
Panorama of Rome Skyline stretching out
in every
direction when we reach the top it was
8:00 a.m. and as you can see the line to
get inside is already starting to grow
longer after finishing at the Vatican we
headed to the Charming CA amama farmers

connects consumers with local farmers
highlighting fresh locally produced
